subject: fix test case 16 to work on arm64
commitMessage:
fix test case 16 to work on arm64

aarch64 does not implement "legacy" system calls such as eventfd.  It
does, of course, support eventfd2, so use that instead.

Package "libaio" cannot be built for architecture "aarch64" because
of build errors.

The same problem appeared in open-source version of libaio during the
build for aarch64. So we have backported it to this repository.

Origin: https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/libaio.git/commit/?id=b564776250eaff47728eb63c25bbefcfd1c0c240
Change-Id: Id8679535afaf57db03f7b06aa5e1bdcceeae64c8
Reported-by: Riku Voipio <riku.voipio@linaro.org>
Signed-off-by: Jeff Moyer <jmoyer@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Ilya Palachev <i.palachev@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

Putting exactly the same description in commit messages of two subsequent commits is not necessary. Otherwise good.

Patch Set 1:

I also agree with Lukasz's comment. You don't need to decribe this message in the commit message. Please remove it and do not describe it in future commit.

Tizen toolchain team in Samsung company is planning to build Tizen for new arm 64 bit architecture.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: add arm64 (aarch64) support
commitMessage:
add arm64 (aarch64) support

The libaio.h changes came from Riku Voipio <riku.voipio@linaro.org>.
The syscall-arm64.h file is an adapter version of the syscall-arm.h
file.

Tizen toolchain team in Samsung company is planning to build Tizen
for new arm 64 bit architecture - Aarch64. But package "libaio"
cannot be built for this architecture because of build errors.

The same problem appeared in open-source version of libaio during the
build for aarch64. So we have backported it to this repository.

Origin: backport, https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/libaio.git/commit/?id=d88423b54b84a483a36ee5c9c20397ce3102385b
Change-Id: I50cac4b69dd02a4fc52b0dcf10b73b0c712ab3d8
Signed-off-by: Jeff Moyer <jmoyer@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Ilya Palachev <i.palachev@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

Please verify that it is possible to build the package with the commits applied and works correctly. Or at least, that the commits do not introduce any regression in the 32-bit systems. The mark the changes (this and the next one) a Verified.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: resetting manifest requested domain to floor
commitMessage: resetting manifest requested domain to floor

Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
